physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Brain MRI showed bilateral malformation of cortical development involving the parietal and occipital lobes, and the posterior parts of the temporal lobes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially averaging 15 CPS per month and daily SPS with secondary generalization once or twice per month; after VNS implantation, CPS reduced by 40% and quicker recovery was observed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Frequency of CPS reduced by 40% and recovery was quicker.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After increasing the stimulation current to 2.5 mA, the patient experienced an abrupt worsening of her epilepsy with daily CPS and visual auras, and new seizure type described as thrashing and kicking of all limbs.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Video EEG telemetry confirmed increased frequency of habitual seizures; posterior rhythmic slowing evolved into regional spiking.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: New seizure type ceased two days after VNS was switched off, and habitual seizures returned to the preimplantation baseline.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: VNS was reactivated and the current was gradually increased to 1.75 mA with no relapse of the new seizure type.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 6 months of follow-up, the patient secured initial improvement with no relapse of the new seizure with frontal lobe semiology.
